result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harley G Stanley

records.addlTxt: For defendant to come from Walworth to court on 11-18-2014
Sentencing hearing on November 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter, Katie Giebel.  2 wk extension granted for preparation of PSI.  Def. in another county  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Harley G Stanley in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Harley G Stanley in custody.  Randal Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Harley G Stanley in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Harley G Stanley in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI-LS $43.00, discuss case, notice of all court hearings (mail), disposition of the case, wishes to make a victim impact statement, will speak at sentencing.
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim LJS (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Harley G Stanley in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Harley G Stanley in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
